customData.content: 30-year-old woman, 6-month pregnant, complained of chronic headaches that eased with a pain reliever.

After the seventh month of pregnancy, the patient complained of slowly progressing left hemiparesis accompanied by numbness in the left sides of the body, and right eyelid ptosis. The patient also felt that the mouth was tilted to the right side and was then referred to the hospital for delivery.

HPI.summary: Patient complained of slowly progressing left hemiparesis accompanied by numbness in the left sides of the body, and right eyelid ptosis. The patient also felt that the mouth was tilted to the right side.
associated_symptoms: mouth tilted to the right side

customData.content: Postpartum head CT scan revealed multiple intracranial masses. Chest X-ray showed vague opacification on the left lung, suspected as lung mass.

imaging.finding: vague opacification on the left lung

customData.content: Patient complained of progressing diplopia and diabetes insipidus.

HPI.summary: Patient complained of progressing diplopia and diabetes insipidus.

customData.content: MRI showed multiple intracranial lesions with morphological cerebrospinal fluid cleft sign in the concavity of the parietal area (dural metastasis), along with multiple lesions on the sellar and suprasellar regions. MR spectroscopy showed lipid peaks.

imaging.finding: multiple intracranial lesions with morphological cerebrospinal fluid cleft sign in the concavity of the parietal area (dural metastasis), along with multiple lesions on the sellar and suprasellar regions

customData.content: Serum cancer antigen (CA) 125 81.0 U/mL. Serum carcinoembryonic antigen 41.06 ng/mL.

Pathology report: metastatic adenocarcinoma in the right parietal area. Chest CT: spiculated mass with cavitation sized 1.9 × 2.5 × 2.05 cm in the apicoposterior segment of the left lung. Chest X-ray showed small opaque lesion superior to the left hilum. Diagnosed with lung adenocarcinoma with multiple intracranial metastases.

imaging.impression: metastatic adenocarcinoma in the right parietal area
spiculated mass with cavitation sized 1.9 × 2.5 × 2.05 cm in the apicoposterior segment of the left lung
small opaque lesion superior to the left hilum

customData.content: MR spectroscopy showed a prominence lipid peak, with low choline in the central lesion. Pathology anatomy from intracranial mass showed tumor mass consisting of round, oval-shaped cells that grow hyperplastic lesions and in groups, some of which are in the structure of the gland and were concluded as metastatic adenocarcinoma. Axial chest CT soft tissue window showed enhancing lesion in the lung parenchyma. Axial chest CT lung window showed a cavitating mass.

imaging.finding: prominence lipid peak, with low choline in the central lesion

procedures.name: Pathology anatomy
procedures.outcome: tumor mass consisting of round, oval-shaped cells that grow hyperplastic lesions and in groups, some of which are in the structure of the gland

data.content: Transition from chronic headaches to left hemiparesis, numbness, and right eyelid ptosis during the seventh month of pregnancy.
Transition from hemiparesis and ptosis to postpartum CT scan revealing intracranial masses and suspected lung mass on chest X-ray.
Transition from imaging findings of intracranial and lung masses to progressing diplopia and diabetes insipidus.
Transition from diplopia and diabetes insipidus to MRI showing multiple intracranial lesions, dural metastasis, and lipid peaks on MR spectroscopy.
Transition from MRI findings to elevated serum cancer antigen (CA) 125 and carcinoembryonic antigen levels.
Transition from elevated serum cancer markers to craniotomy for tumor removal.

Transition from craniotomy to pathology report confirming metastatic adenocarcinoma, chest CT showing a spiculated mass in the left lung, and diagnosis of lung adenocarcinoma with multiple intracranial metastases.
Transition from initial diagnosis of lung adenocarcinoma with intracranial metastases to further characterization via MR spectroscopy, pathology anatomy, and axial chest CT.
